articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Attorneys say jail staff violated policies in inmate’s death
articles.description: Attorneys for the family of a man who died in the Fremont County jail say inmates were abruptly cut off from certain prescription drugs in spite of policies against such actions.

articles.author: Carie Canterbury
articles.title: Former Fremont County Sheriff’s Office Detective Robert Dodd found guilty on three counts
articles.description: Former Fremont County Sheriff's Office Detective Robert Dodd was found guilty on three of four counts relating to the possession of murder evidence in a personal storage unit by a jury Thursday.

articles.author: Canon City Daily Record
articles.title: Man accused of setting RV on fire, gets shot at by deputy, runs truck into sheriff’s vehicle
articles.description: The man who allegedly set a Coaldale RV on fire Sunday night crashed a stolen truck into a Fremont County Sheriff's Office vehicle after an officer fired shots at him,

articles.author: Noelle Phillips
articles.title: Denver set to approve $102,000 settlement for inmate injured during a seizure
articles.description: The city of Denver will pay a former County Jail inmate and his lawyers $102,000 after he fell over a stairwell during an epileptic seizure. Doctors had written orders for him to be housed in a ground level cell, but those orders were ignored.

articles.author: Jeffrey A. Roberts
articles.title: What investigative journalism means for our communities
articles.description: Unfortunately, the contraction of the news industry means fewer journalist watchdogs. And that puts our state and our communities in danger.

articles.author: Christopher N. Osher
articles.title: Spike in felony crimes has Colorado prosecutors pushing back against sentencing, parole reforms
articles.description: Felony criminal filings across the state of Colorado increased by nearly 50 percent in the last five years, prompting some prosecutors to complain that recent criminal justice reforms may be letting dangerous individuals roam the streets.
